translations: adj.<罕>实时反应的，非预先准备的

phrs.translation: 先买权, 优先认购权, 优先购买权
先发制人战略, 先发制人计谋, 視·, 䴿·
先发制人的, 先发制人
立即反击, 先制攻击

sentences.sentence: They decided to launch a pre-emptive strike.
sentences.translation: 他们决定发动先发制人的攻击。

sentences.sentence: With interrupts enabled, the pre-emptive scheduler periodically takes control to provide multitasking.
sentences.translation: 通过启用中断，抢占式的调度器就可以周期性地接管控制权，从而提供多任务处理能力。

sentences.sentence: So I took pre-emptive action, composing on index cards a list of reasons why he and I should still hang out.
sentences.translation: 因此我先发制人，在索引卡片上列出了我和他仍然应该约出去的原因。
